hints.content: Let's try each set of stacks to see whether it equals $56$ cards.

###$6$ stacks of $9$ cards

![6 stacks of 9 cards](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a9d3e73e3772d3c91430356702b4cf89bdfce9c6)

$9+9+9+9+9+9=54$ , so Bo *cannot* stack her $56$ cards this way.

###$7$ stacks of $8$ cards

![7 stacks of 8 cards](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/017bfcefe0e5143612375361b9a99ef72eb67a8b)

$8+8+8+8+8+8+8=56$ , so Bo can stack her cards this way.

###$8$ stacks of $7$ cards

![8 stacks of 7 cards](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b19d65a804c302b93d61c05a73b22af1a37d2cf5)

$7+7+7+7+7+7+7+7=56$ , so Bo can stack her cards this way.

###$9$ stacks of $6$ cards

![9 stacks of 6 cards](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d287c94c1bc0cf84dc478708052461205983af9e)

$6+6+6+6+6+6+6+6+6=54$

So Bo *cannot* stack her $56$ cards this way.

Bo can stack her cards these ways:

- $7$ stacks of $8$ cards
- $8$ stacks of $7$ cards

[[☃ explanation 1]]

question.content:
Bo has $56$ cards.

**What are two ways Bo can stack her cards?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.clue: This would be $54$ cards instead of $56$ cards.
This would be $54$ cards instead of $56$ cards.
